requests.name: Agronomic Values & Accumulations
requests.description:
####Request
This API call gets calculated agronomics and accumulations at a field location. 

The URL used here will get the values for a certain range of days. This is a very flexible API and so you're encouraged to review the [Agronomics Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/agronomics/values).

_Tip: Remember to use a field ID that exists in your account. By default, this collection uses a default field ID of 'field1'_


####Security
This API call uses the security Access T

requests.name: Agronomic Norms
requests.description:
####Request
This API call gets the long term averages for agronomic values and accumulations at a field location. 

The URL used here will get the values for a certain range of days over a certain range of years. This is a very flexible API and so you're encouraged to review the [Agronomics Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/agronomics/norms).

_Tip: Remember to use a field ID that exists in your account. By default, this collection uses a default field ID of 'field1'_


##

requests.name: Get Fields List
requests.description:
####Request
This API call retrieves the list of fields in your account. 

[Get Fields Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/fields/get-fields)


####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved with the "Get a Token" request. If you run that request first, it will save a token to Postman and this API will use it automatically. You can also see where the token should normally go by clicking the "Headers" tab below. The Authorization header holds the t

requests.name: Create a Field
requests.description:
####Request
This API call creates a field location in your account. Be sure to change the body payload. 

[Create Fields Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/fields/create-field)


####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved with the "Get a Token" request. If you run that request first, it will save a token to Postman and this API will use it automatically. You can also see where the token should normally go by clicking the "Headers" tab below.

requests.name: Get a Single Field by ID
requests.description:

You can also see where the token should normally go by clicking the "Headers" tab below. The Authorization header holds the token, replacing

requests.name: Update Field
requests.description:
####Request
This API call shows how to update the farm ID on a field location. You can also change the name.

requests.name: Create a Planting
requests.description:

__Note:__ You should at least change the dates in the request body.

[Create Planting Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/plantings/create)

requests.description:
####Request
This API call shows how to update only a couple of fields in a planting instead of having to update the entire object.

__Note:__ You probably what to change the date in the request body.

requests.name: Get Model Details
requests.description:
####Request
This API call returns the details about a particular model. Currently, growth stage models are available via the API, so the details are a list of the possible stages with GDD threshold information. 

[Model Details Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/models/details).


####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved with the "Get a Token" request. If you run that request first, it will save a token to Postman and this API will use it

requests.name: Get Model Results
requests.description:
####Request
This API call returns the current results of a model based on the data provided for the identified field location. 

[Model Results Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/models/results).


####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved with the "Get a Token" request. If you run that request first, it will save a token to Postman and this API will use it automatically. You can also see where the token should normally go by clicking the "

requests.name: Daily Observations
requests.description:
####Request
This API call gets the weather at a field location.

The default URL will get the last seven days of actual weather observations. You can add dates to the end of the URL to get the weather for a specific range of days, like so: 

`/v2/weather/fields/field1/observations/2015-08-01` gets a single day
`/v2/weather/fields/field1/observations/2015-08-01,2015-08-15` gets everything from August 1-15

You can customize the response payload using query string parameters. Learn more in the [Da

requests.name: Forecasts
requests.description:
####Request
This API call gets the forecast at a field location.

With the default configuration you'll get the hourly forecast for today +8 days. Add dates to the end of the URL to request only specific days, like so: 

`/v2/weather/fields/field1/forecasts/YYYY-MM-DD` returns a single day
`/v2/weather/fields/field1/forecasts/YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD` returns a range of days

You can also use query string parameters to customize the payloads. Read the [Forecast Documentation](http://developer.awher

requests.name: Norms
requests.description:
####Request
Use this API to calculate long-term averages for the weather for any set of days across any set of years (minumum 3). This is a very flexible API, and you're encouraged to review the [Weather Norms Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/weather/norms) for details.

_Tip: Remember to use a field ID that exists in your account. By default, this collection uses a default field ID of 'field1'_

####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved

requests.name: Current Conditions
requests.description:
####Request
This API call provides a snapshot of recent weather using the weather station nearest to the field location.

[Current Conditions Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/reference/weather/current)

_Tip: Remember to use a field ID that exists in your account. By default, this collection uses a default field ID of 'field1'_


####Security
This API call uses the security Access Token that is retrieved with the "Get a Token" request. If you run that request first, it will save a

requests.name: Get a Token
requests.description:
This is the first API call you will make any time you use the API 
(but you only need to use once per hour). This request will 
request a security access token and save it to Postman. Later 
API calls will use the token from Postman's saved variables. 

[Authentication Documentation](http://developer.awhere.com/api/authentication)

Prior to using this API call you should load the aWhere Environment
file into Postman and change the settings to your API Key and Secret.
You can also see where the k
